item.title: 2021 Cabernet Franc
item.description:
Our Cabernet Franc is grown in our East Bench Osoyoos, B.C. vineyard. Blessed with unfiltered sunshine from dawn till dusk and cooled by the nearby lake at night, this unique combination of sandy soils and granite produces a premium Cabernet Franc. Tasting notes: Nose: Blackberries, Currants, Raspberry, Dark Cherry, Spice & Violets. Palate: Dark Cherry, Blackberry, Chocolate, Vanilla, SpiceBody: Medium to HighSweetness: DryTannins: Medium & SilkyAcidity: HighFinish: Very Long Serving Recommendations: Serving Temperature: 16-18C / 60-64FDecanting Time: 30-60 minutesServing Glass: UniversalCellar Recommendation: 0 to 5 years
Wine Profile Vineyard Notes
100% of these grapes come from the East Bench block at Monarch Vineyards in Osoyoos, B.C. Deep sand runs throughout, encouraging plant stress, while the lake helps balance the nighttime temperatures. Granite is intermingled with the sand, adding mineral depth. Perfect for cultivating high-quality Cabernet Franc grapes.
Production Notes
All of these grapes were harvested at 24.5 brix which allowed the grapes to develop an exquisite flavor profile. This wine was pumped over 3 times a day during the fermentation period Aged for 19 months in new American Oak barrels
Technical Data
TA: 6.48 g/L pH: 3.65 Alc: 13.6% RS: 4.31 g/L
item.summary: 92 Points - Dive into a velvety embrace of blackberry and dark cherry, with whispers of chocolate and spice and a truly long-lasting finish.

item.title: 2021 Cabernet Merlot
item.description:
Discover a captivating blend, born from our family-owned vineyards in Oliver and Osoyoos, B.C. The silky smooth Merlot intertwines with the elegance of Cabernet Franc, while a touch of structured Cabernet Sauvignon adds depth, yielding an exceptional wine that combines the essence of our vineyards. This blend comprises 46.67% Cabernet Franc, 36% Merlot & 17.33% Cabernet Sauvignon. Tasting notes: Nose: Intense Black Cherry and Cassis. Palate: Ripe Blackberry, Dark Cherry, Black Currant, and Mocha Body: Medium to HighSweetness: DryTannins: Medium to High; Soft/VelvetyAcidity: HighFinish: Very Long Serving Recommendations: Serving Temperature: 16-18C / 60-64FDecanting Time: 30-60 minutesServing Glass: Universal or OversizedCellar Recommendation: 0 to 6 years
Wine Profile Vineyard Notes
This wine displays the essence of all of our family's vineyards at Monarch Vineyards. Each variety included in this wine comes from a different location.
The Merlot hails from the Paradise block in Northern Oliver, B.C. The Cabernet Sauvignon comes from the West Bench block in Osoyoos, B.C. The Cabernet Franc was grown on our East Bench block in Osoyoos, B.C.
The unique growing conditions or "terroir" of each of these sites cultivates grapes with their own distinct flavor profiles. Production Notes
We wanted to make sure that the berries developed our desired flavor profile at harvest which is why we waited until the brix levels were above 24 for all three varieties:
Merlot was harvested at 24 brix Cabernet Sauvignon was harvested at 24 brix Cabernet Franc was harvested at 24.5 brix.
All of these wines were fermented in stainless steel tanks with three pumpovers on a daily basis. Aged in barrels for 19 months
Cabernet Sauvignon was aged 50% in New American Oak and 50% in Neutral Oak Cabernet Franc was aged entirely in New American Oak Merlot was aged 25% in New American Oak and 75% in Neutral Oak.
Technical Data
TA: 6.26 g/L pH: 3.69 Alcohol: 13.5% RS: 4.26 g/L
item.summary: 92 Points - Unveil the essence of black cherry, blackberry and cassis. Decant to reveal layers of richness, blending cherry, currant, and mocha with a captivating long finish.

item.title: 2021 Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description:
Nestled on the east-facing slopes of our West Bench Block in Osoyoos, B.C., the moderated heat and even sunlight foster the growth of exceptional grapes. This unique growing site yields a Cabernet Sauvignon that is truly distinct. Tasting notes: Ripe plums and fresh mint on the nose; succulent dark berries with lingering toast on the palate Serving Recommendations: Serving Temperature: 16-18C / 60-64FDecanting Time: 60 minutesServing Glass: Oversized and/or Bordeaux Cellar Recommendation: 2 to 10 years
Wine Profile Vineyard Notes
100% of the grapes used to produce this wine are from the West Bench block at Monarch Vineyards in Osoyoos, B.C. Growing Characteristics:
Even the distribution of heat from the morning and afternoon sunlight Mild Eastern-facing slope that arcs towards the lake and mitigates some of the burning heat typical to the region Sandy soils with traces of granite deposits offer great drainage to help develop a strong root system for the vines
Production Notes
All of these grapes were harvested at 24 brix Fermented in stainless steel tanks with 3 pump-overs per day Aged for 19 months in 50% new American Oak and 50% Neutral Oak barrels

item.title: 2021 Merlot
item.description:
Our Paradise Block Merlot comes from grapes grown on the land where our father's dreams took root. Caressed by the morning sun, embraced by cool nights, and influenced by the heat from the hillside rockface, these Merlot grapes produce a wine that everyone can enjoy! Tasting notes: Nose: Medium Intensity; Blackberry, Red Plum, Ripe Cherry, Tobacco Palate: Mixed Berry Compote, Mocha, Dark Cherry, Red Plum, Cedar, Subtle CranberryBody: MediumColour: Deep RubyAcidity: Medium To HighSweetness: DryTannins: Soft/PlushFinish: Long Serving Recommendations: Serving Temperature: 16-18C / 60-64FDecanting Time: 30 minutesServing Glass: Oversized and/or BordeauxCellar Recommendation: 0 to 5 years
Winemaker's Notes: Vineyard Notes
All of these grapes are grown at the Paradise block of Monarch Vineyards, located in Northern Oliver, B.C. This vineyard integrates silt from the nearby Okanagan River and its conjoining floodplains.
Pockets of this vineyard show gravel, rock, and sand which allow for great drainage and offer a warming effect. There is balanced sunlight throughout the day without the morning and afternoon extremes. The large rockface on the hillside offers a warming effect to the vines. Cool nighttime temperatures allow the vines to reduce stress levels during extreme heat.
Production Notes
All of these grapes were harvested at 24 brix Fermented in stainless steel tanks with 3 pump-overs per day Aged for 19 months
25% new American Oak barrels 75% Neutral Oak barrels (a combination of French & American)
item.summary: NEW - 90 Points - Experience the symphony of flavors with every sip â€“ from luscious mixed berry compote and mocha to the rich notes of dark cherry. This Merlot envelopes your senses with plush tannins and a finish that lingers, truly capturing the essence of its aroma.

item.title: 2022 Chardonnay
item.description:
Nestled in the Similkameen Valley, Jagger Rock Vineyard thrives beneath a mountain rich in limestone. The vineyard's rocky terrain promotes warmth around the clock, cultivating grapes that yield a delightful flavour profile. Tasting Notes: Nose: Lemon zest, green apple, fresh pear, and a subtle hint of pineapple and minerality.Palate: Dry, crisp, green apple, anjou pear with a subtle hint of lemon, pineapple, and minerality. Serving Recommendations: Serving Temperature: 10-13C / 49-55FServing Glass: White Wine GlassCellar Recommendation: 0 to 2 years
Winemaker's Notes Vineyard Notes
Jagger Rock Vineyard is located in Cawston, B.C. alongside a mountain that is rich in limestone deposits
These limestone deposits provide calcium minerals to deposit into the soil in the vineyard
Allows for exceptional vine root development Allows for better nutrient exchange for the vines Allows for optimal sugar and acidity development in the grapes Great for water sustainability
The remaining terrain of the vineyard is composed of rock and shale which provide a warming effect around the clock.
Production Notes
All of these grapes were harvested at 23 Brix Fermented and aged in stainless steel Unoaked
Technical Data
TA: 8.33 g/L pH: 3.55 Alcohol: 11.9% RS: 2.15 g/L
item.summary: 91 Points - Delve into a bright beginning of zesty lime, followed by a vibrant medley of citrus, green apple, and a whisper of pineapple.
